Articles.Content:
Ive been having issues getting this mod to work,i havent played KSP for a couple years and just came back to it,i put the newest version of the mod i could find(112.0.1-bleeding-edge.1)into the <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)"><abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr></abbr> folder but the actual life support isnt there,the parts and resources from the mod are there though.Ive already tried a couple things like putting the files from source into gamedata as well or using older US-LS versions,but nothing works.Im using KSP 1.12.3,also what might be causing it is I havent been able to install <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr> Tools,i have no idea how to do it correctly,the folder doesnt seem to contain anything that can be put into GameData

**Edited <time datetime="2022-02-12T14:09:32Z" title="02/12/2022 02:09  PM" data-short="2 yr">February 12, 2022</time> by Dragonking**

Hello there!  First, I really enjoy what <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr> Life Support adds to the game, requiring more strategic mission planning and craft design. ![:cool:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cool.gif ":cool:")

So, on to my question.  This is my first save using <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr>-LS, and I'm finding that my Kerbalnauts-turned-tourists, do not return to active after resupply.  To be more specific, this can include a fully docked resupply craft (dock-o-tron Sr. mostly) with plenty of additional supplies and possibly additional life support modules as well.  The <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr>-LS info block will show they have dozens or hundres of days of additional supplies , habitat is indefinite, electricity is abundant, etc.  However, the Kerbalnauts stay in tourist mode.  Any thoughts on why that may be?  Did I forget a complementary addon?  A setting I didn't set?  Any advice would be appreciated. 

I have <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr> Life Support, Core, and Tools installed from <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr>.  I have a number of other mods as well, mostly visual, but I'll list them all below for perusal if desired, but I've added some of these (like MkI2and Mk3 extended parts lists) after I first had this issue.  I've really just been sitting on this issue for a month or more as I've worked around it by .... simply ignoring the issue.  ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif ";)")  

Thanks for any help!

> 
> 
> On 2/12/2022 at 9:06 AM, Dragonking said:
> 
> 
> Ive been having issues getting this mod to work,i havent played KSP for a couple years and just came back to it,i put the newest version of the mod i could find(112.0.1-bleeding-edge.1)into the <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)"><abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr></abbr> folder but the actual life support isnt there,the parts and resources from the mod are there though.Ive already tried a couple things like putting the files from source into gamedata as well or using older US-LS versions,but nothing works.Im using KSP 1.12.3,also what might be causing it is I havent been able to install <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)"><abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr></abbr> Tools,i have no idea how to do it correctly,the folder doesnt seem to contain anything that can be put into GameData
> 

USITools is a requirement for pretty much all <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr> mods. The latest <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr>-LS release is actually bleeding-edge.2 and can be found on the Releases page of the <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr>-LS GitHub repo here: [https://github.com/UmbraSpaceIndustries/<abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr>-LS/releases](https://github.com/UmbraSpaceIndustries/USI-LS/releases). There are 3 download links under Assets:

- <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr>-LS\_112.0.1-bleeding-edge.2.zip  **<-- this is the one you want**
- Source code (zip)
- Source code (tar.gz)

When you open or extract the .zip file, there will be a single folder inside called GameData and some text files. You need to copy the entire ***contents*** of the GameData folder from the .zip file into the KSP GameData folder. The resulting folder structure should look something like this:

- [Root KSP folder]
    - GameData
        - 000\_USITools **<-- required**
        - CommunityCategoryKit **<-- required**
        - UmbraSpaceIndustries **<-- required**
            - FX
            - LifeSupport
        - ModuleManager4.x.x.dll **<-- required, whatever the latest version is**
        - Squad
        - SquadExpansion
        - [... any other mods you have installed]

Ive managed to get help from somewhere else now,my problem was that i wasnt able to find the correct version,i was getting to the github from the old <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)"><abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr></abbr> website,the site that that directs to doesnt have anything in releases,only in tags,and the version that was there didnt include <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)"><abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr></abbr> tools or any of the other dependencies,so it was mostly a website issue,but thanks for the help

I have a question.

I'm using <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr>-LS's ModuleLifeSupportRecycler, set up to require constant Ore input and 100% efficiency. Will this cause any issues, such as divide by 0?

> 
> 
> 4 hours ago, SkyFall2489 said:
> 
> 
> I have a question.
> 
> 
> 
> 
>  
> 
> 
> 
> 
> I'm using <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)"><abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr></abbr>-LS's ModuleLifeSupportRecycler, set up to require constant Ore input and 100% efficiency. Will this cause any issues, such as divide by 0?
> 

Doubtful tbh, give it a shot and see if you get spammed by NREs ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")

Would it be possible to replace the current USI\_LS <abbr title="In-Situ Resource Utilization">ISRU</abbr> Fertilizer patch with a slightly different one, that changes all ISRUs, including mod parts, by cloning the ModuleResourceConverter for Monoprop?

Look at SimpleConstruction, that mod does something similar to make Metal from Ore in all ISRUs.

> 
> 
> 33 minutes ago, SkyFall2489 said:
> 
> 
> Would it be possible to replace the current USI\_LS <abbr title="In-Situ Resource Utilization"><abbr title="In-Situ Resource Utilization">ISRU</abbr></abbr> Fertilizer patch with a slightly different one, that changes all ISRUs, including mod parts, by cloning the ModuleResourceConverter for Monoprop?
> 
> 
> 
> 
> Look at SimpleConstruction, that mod does something similar to make Metal from Ore in all ISRUs.
> 

You're welcome to do it with a module manager patch, but that's too much of a destructive patch to include in the mod.
Wait, for some reason, that patch doesn't work...

Are there any good guides/explanations on how habitation/home works? I broadly understand it, I just want to know what the precise mechanics are and what it's affected by.

One of the things that I am thinking about is long term stays at other planets with stations that are constructed ahead of time and I am trying to think of how to engineer my shuttles that'll take them there and back. How are Kerbals affected when they're transferred from a station outfitted with lots of habitation for multiple years to a shuttle with enough habitation to get them back to Kerbin from Duna?

At a loss with that many mods.  My suggestion is to start with a clean install, install the <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr> stuff, then begin installing other mods till you hit the conflict.
Thank you!

The <abbr title="1. Original Post(er). The first post in a thread, or the person who posted it. 2. Overpowered. A part or mechanic that upsets game balance by being too powerful.">OP</abbr> still links to the releases page for the now disused BobPalmer github repo.

Hey there! This isn't super important, but why is the bleeding edge released called "BleedingEdge"? That seems like a strange name lol. How do orbital logistics work in MKS? I'm quite new to modding KSP, so its a tad intimidating. <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr>-LS seems simple enough, but not too simple. I'd also like to add MKS to add some challenge ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")

[@ArthritisGuy](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/221323-arthritisguy/)you can always start with [https://github.com/UmbraSpaceIndustries/MKS/wiki](https://github.com/UmbraSpaceIndustries/MKS/wiki)

> 
> 
> 1 hour ago, ArthritisGuy said:
> 
> 
> Hey there! This isn't super important, but why is the bleeding edge released called "BleedingEdge"? That seems like a strange name lol.
> 

It's an evolution of cutting edge. Bleeding edge is so extremely cutting edge that you might cut yourself and start bleeding (probably because of all the bugs) :-)

Except there aren't that many bugs![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif ":D")

It's more like blunt release.

That's awesome lmao. 

> 
> 
> 17 minutes ago, Grimmas said:
> 
> 
> Bleeding edge is so extremely cutting edge that you might cut yourself and start bleeding (probably because of all the bugs) :-)
> 

Actually, I can see this going the other way--makin the bugs bleed lol. Thanks a ton, I'll start with <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr>-LS and move my way to MKS, just so I have the hang of <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr>-LS ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")
